titleStmt.title: J. E. Josney to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1812

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Pendleton County Ky Mar 7/64
Bramlett Gov: of Ky
D Sir

I am about removing out of Election District No 4 in this County wherein I was elected last May one of the Justices of peace for the County, and therefore I herewith tender you my resignation of said officer And in expectation that you will appoint a successor, the district standing much in need of one, permit to recommend my as suc my sucessor J V Prebble as a suitable person, he being a true loyal and law abiding citizens. to the US and State

Respectfully yours & c
J. E. Gosney

Accepted
write to some loyal man for recommendation the county Judge I presume is loyal
